body:
This is wrong pr, should to develop not master.
Closed

Thanks for the contribution, Peter, it is merged in https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/commit/502c7e37f842eabc4021c47053dd95bdd1c7efde
Please close this PR.
Good to see that stateCheck can be aligned with policy evaluation, that would be easy for user to define state rules.  LGTM.
LGTM. but to complete application conversion, we need complete configuration in metadata.xml like application.conf. Future, we may be able to reduce this duplication.
Thanks for the contribution, could you please make sure the changes could make other test cases using `EmbeddedHbase` able to pass?
Branch-0.4 already released. And we have major change in v0.5. Looks this PR deprecated to me. Can we abandon and close this one? @yonzhang @haoch
I still have concern with why Hive can't share spout with JPM applications, but we can refactor after this PR

LGTM. We keep hadoop-jmx project there to put all related policies, metadata there.
But this application does not need any pre-processing logic
Operation by mistake to this Repo. Sorry.

The serialization/deserialization of org.apache.eagle.jpm.mr.runningentity.JobConfig is a little complicated. Since it is a java HashMap,  should we consider to use java build-in  serialization/deserialization?

If you declare a field as Map, then eagle will automatically adopt java build-in serialization/deserialization. 
Although JobConfig extends from Map, but eagle still regards it as a user-define type object.
The unit test seems to fail on windows dev environment.

HBase related unit test cases are very slow and failed with following exception:

```
[main] ERROR org.apache.eagle.service.hbase.EmbeddedHbase - Got an exception: 
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: org.apache.hadoop.io.nativeio.NativeIO$Windows.access0(Ljava/lang/String;I)Z
    at org.apache.hadoop.io.nativeio.NativeIO$Windows.access0(Native Method)
    at org.apache.hadoop.io.nativeio.NativeIO$Windows.access(NativeIO.java:609)
    at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileUtil.canWrite(FileUtil.java:996)

    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

    at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12)
```

i am looking at this problem.
still see hbase test failure due to misconfiguration. develop is supress hbase tests. once fixed, pls reenable them.

@haoch @RalphSu 
This is the environment issue, for running in windows you need 
1.  let hadoop.dll could be loaded, this is usually done by setting path variable or manually set library path, i,e, **-Djava.library.path=D:\Devtool\hadoop-util\bin**
2  To avoid path exceeding 255, run with **-Dtest.build.data.basedirectory=d:\t** ,
@haoch , I think we need write a new test class instead of modifying TestHBaseLogReader2.
Looks good to me. Please do more testing and merge then.
Build failed due to `org.apache.eagle.service.alert.resource.impl.MongoImplTest`, @RalphSu could you pls. have a look?
Seems to have duplicated commits with #369 ? Pls. confirm, so that we could simply merge this PR and ignore #369.

One of the target is to make sure alert engine could be decoupled to run on both Storm and Spark, while they should share the same metadata, I don't understand why do we need spark specific metadata like: `SpecMetadataResource`?
It was because of the conflicts with the previous check style commit. I have fixed it.
Could we just catch the `shutdown` exception and print logs instead of throw out? Exception message matching related condition looks lot very solid :-)
@haoch , modified it, please take a look.

@DadanielZ very glad to see you to start to review and merge contributed PR, just remind that you could also use [`eagle-dev/merge-eagle-pr.py`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/blob/develop/eagle-dev/merge-eagle-pr.py) besides manually doing it.
@haoch Thank you, this is very useful 👍
The jenkins check failure is due to the previous commit. Please see the console log.

For now , I fetch spec config directly from metadata service, Just skip coordinator service. So I create a simple service just return spec config. In the future , I will consider to refactor coordinator service base on Spark platform.
LGTM, will merge once jenkins pass.
Duplicate code. Need a better package Utils for this.
It seems there is no retry logic now. Please verify the code. I think something is missing.
Looks good to me now.  It will be better have a sleep for some seconds when you emit it.

This is a good tip to void high CPU usage on retry.
I have updated it to sleep 3 secs.
Merged as https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/commit/a10eeb7019b8eff964316b084c0b25b68bf58b44, pls. close the PR.
Tks. I will close PR right now.
The implementation seems a little tricky, `https` physically has nothing to do with 443, thought it is always treated as default https port. :-)

Right. I just simply assumed that the default port for https is 443 and see how you would deal with it. To be more accurate, the implementation should be more complicated. I'll see if we can use any library api.

Or, can we just use the url without "http://" or "https://" and let DNS to resolve it?

Simply, can we just keep the configured url and not adding any scheme "http://" or "https://"?
Say, "server.eagle.apache.org" or "http://server.eagle.apache.org".

Can we just use a config like "eagle.service : http://server.eagle.apache.org:9099"?
It should be more straightforward, shouldn't it?

This config will be set by users.

Pls. clean the commit history firstly. 

> `TIPS`: you are recommended to create a new branch based on latest updated `develop` instead of feature branch.
good fix, but Senthil can you do PR against develop branch?
Thanks for the improvement. Why we create a new AbstractMapRFSAuditLogApplication, can't we use AbstractHdfsAuditLogApplication? They share the same code
Thanks for the fix. We can remove the internal try/catch and only use outer try/catch to catch exception and finally it will do ack anyway
